IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To motivate and direct its students to seek holistic development that leads to intellectual, ethical, spiritual and service-oriented lives.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To motivate and direct its students to seek holistic development that leads to intellectual, ethical, spiritual and service-oriented lives.
IRS990.Description: Miles College is an institution for higher education and provides instruction, scholarship and various support services in achieving its primary purpose of educating students.

Activity2.Description: Auxiliary enterprises support the Colleges mission of providing quality educational opportunities. These services include, but are not limited to food service, campus housing, campus post office, parking, vending, campus stores and athletics.

ProgramServiceRevenue.Description: Sales and Services of Auxiliary Enterprises

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Endowment Funds shown are considered Permanently Restriced. The College does not intend to use the funds.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The College admits students of any race, color, national or ethnic origin. The College does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin in the administration of its educational policies, scholarships or loan programs and athletic and school administered programs. The Colleges non-discrimination statement appears in all brochures and applications for admission.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The College offers scholarships and financial aid to assist students with meeting their financial obligations. The financial aid office has the necessary policies and procedures to ensure that the College adheres to and complies with federal regulations regarding eligibility for student financial aid. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend on other factors such as grade point average, family income, or athletic talents. The College has adequate staff in its other grant programs with eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required OMB Circular A-133 audit.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The College presents the Form 990 to its finance committee for review before it is filed. The College plans to implement an acknowledgement form for each member to sign indicating their approval.

Trustees are required to disclose at the next convening Board of Trustees meeting any conflict of interest. Board members with a conflict of interest with a matter for vote must abstain from voting. The Colleges audit committee is responsible for ensuring adherence to the policy.

The Board of Trustees, based on predetermined areas of performance, evaluates the work of the President annually. The Boards Evaluation and Compensation Committee evaluates the performance. When additional compensation is deemed appropraite, a review of salaries of Presidents at peer institutions is conducted to assist in arriving at a recommnedation to the Executive Committee for approval. Compensation for top officers of the college are at the discretion of the President. This discretion is performed by 1 previous salary history, 2 market data from the CUPA survey published in the Chroncile of Higher Education.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Schedule E Form 990 or 990-EZ Financial Aid or Government Assistance
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Line 6a The org receives aid, Line 6b The org has had their aid revoked or suspended.
